summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and 4-xylene are both volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are part of the BTEX group, which is monitored for exposure levels in public transport environments due to their association with vehicular emissions. The study focuses on measuring these compounds in various commuting microenvironments in Hong Kong, indicating a shared relevance in assessing air quality and exposure risks related to traffic pollution. However, there is no specific discussion of their individual interactions or comparative significance within the study.
